cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ESE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, then turning north and north-northeast just off the Florida east coast toward the Georgia and Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ocracoke Inlet NC to Watch Hill RI, including inland tidal rivers and bays
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL to Ocracoke Inlet NC (Tropical Storm Warning) and Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC (Storm-Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, Georgia coast, the Carolinas, and the U.S. mid-Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts possible in outer rain bands.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the west-central Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain to the Tampa Bay area on 2–3 August.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Enhanced rip-current risk along Gulf beaches; minor operational delays from squalls.
